text: {{Infobox zone |name = Koshi |settlement_type = Zone |motto = |image_skyline = |imagesize = 300px |image_caption = |image_map = Koshi districts.png |mapsize = 300px |map_caption = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Nepal |subdivision_type1 = Region |subdivision_name1 = |seat_type = Capital |seat = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = |established_date = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = |population_as_of = 2011 |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 2,335,047 |population_density_km2 = |blank_name_sec1 = Main language(s) |blank_info_sec1 = |timezone = Nepal Time |utc_offset = +5:45 |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |website = |footnotes = }} Koshi was one of the fourteen zones of Nepal. The headquarters and largest city of Koshi Zone was Biratnagar. Other major cities of Koshi Zone were Inaruwa, Dharan, Dhankuta and Itahari. Its main rivers are the Arun, Tamor, and Sapta Koshi. Koshi had six districts. These were Bhojpur, Dhankuta, Morang, Sankhuwasabha, Sunsari and Terhathum. District Type Headquarters Bhojpur Hill Bhojpur Dhankuta Hill Dhankuta Morang Terai Biratnagar Sankhuwasabha Mountain Khandbari Sunsari Terai Inaruwa Terhathum Hill Myanglung ==Famous Religious Places== * Pindeswari Temple, Dharan * Buda Subba, Dharan * Panchakanya Temple, Dharan * Bishnupaduka, Dharan * Kali Mandir, Biratnagar ==Related pages== *Zones of Nepal *Districts of Nepal *Development Regions of Nepal == References == Category:Zones of Nepal
title: Kosi Zone
